TRENTON - Gov. Chris Christie 's foreign policy speech Sunday night is facing some criticism at home - from a fellow Republican .
State Sen. Michael Doherty ( R - Warren ) , one of the most conservative New Jersey lawmakers , said Christie 's vision for America 's role in the world is unsustainable .
Christie on Sunday night gave a hawkish speech calling for the United States to take a clearer role in world affairs .
Christie on Sunday night gave a hawkish speech calling for the United States to take a clearer role in world affairs .
Christie on Sunday night gave a hawkish speech calling for the United States to take a clearer role in world affairs .
America is no longer sending clear signals to the world .
Consistent signals , Christie said in front of a crowd of about 700 at the Champions of Jewish Values International Awards Gala in New York .

Signals like the ones Ronald Reagan sent when he was president as to who our friends are , and we will stand with them without a doubt , and who our enemies are , who we will oppose regardless of the cost .

A0: State Sen. Michael Doherty -LRB- R-Warren -RRB- , one of the most conservative New Jersey lawmakers
RelatedSentence: Doherty supported former U.S. Rep. Ron Paul of Texas , an anti-interventionist , for the Republican presidential nomination in 2012 .
